title: back in season 3 we could see teammates ping on loading screen

replies.body:
It created a toxic environment. You know those toaster jokes if someone takes a while to load? Same thing if they had high ping during loading screen.
'Oh no, mid has high ping, must be a foreigner!' And cue the endless insults.

> [{quoted}](name=Krigjer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ai4Ekbnm,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2017-05-14T04:45:32.330+0000)
>
> It created a toxic environment. You know those toaster jokes if someone takes a while to load? Same thing if they had high ping during loading screen.
> 'Oh no, mid has high ping, must be a foreigner!' And cue the endless insults.

and how that any different than seeing a player in either team take 5 min to reach 100%?

> and how that any different than seeing a player in either team take 5 min to reach 100%?

It's not, but what players do with that information does differ.

Knowing how long your teammate is going to take to LOAD IN is useful information. Seeing it tick from 60% to 70% lets you visually know if your game has crashed/frozen or if they're just not loading.

Seeing if one of your teammates has high ping and singling them out for abuse is not useful.

Loading time isn't even bound in any significant way by ping. If you have 200 ping it will take you 100 milliseconds longer than someone with 0 ping on the same PC as you, the time it takes for data to reach the server from your PC.

Load time has nothing to do with ping, only really the strength of your PC. It's impossible to determine that someone's playing from another country by the amount of time it takes them to load, where as you can work this out with ping.

well if it was ranked i would report him XD, maybe not on {{champion:107}}  but if he was playing some other ping reliant champs... yeah...

maybe it becuase i play nidalee and having high ping makes her impossible (your not going to land a spear at that ping)... but right now i dont play ranked because every 5 min or so my ping spikes from 66 to 180 for about 3 seconds... before going back down to 66.

obviously if its unranked thats fine... and certain champs dont really NEED low ping. (i mean hell i have seen NB3 play in Brazil server on certain champs can do fine)

but there ARE champs (like nidalee) that are VERY ping reliant.. and playing them at high ping IN RANKED is _asking_ to lose.
because people would use it to exploit weak links in the enemy team obviously.

Riot removed this because it made people distrust teammates based on arbitrary numbers.

Kinda like rank.
Yet they keep rank around to appease those arrogant elitists lol.

It also gives more incentive for people to play more, gives a good season objective (Gold+ for skin), and helps players easily get some idea of how skilled the people they are playing with are (there is at least some difference between Gold I and Bronze V).

Without ranked, I'd probably have gotten bored of this game a long while ago.  It would be kinda like Super Smash games, really fun every so often, but repetitive after a bit.  The ranking gets my competitive nature going and makes me play more (and I like free skins).
I played more when the game felt fair and balanced, not because rank mattered more then. But that's just a general complaint with riot repeatedly fiddling with the matchmaking code.

As you can see, ping was removed for a good reason. You can now ping your ping (hah!) anyway, and I've literally never been in a case where people don't accept it as an answer. At least thus far.

Riot has to handle their playerbase very carefully because a lot of small things can blow up in big ways. It's like why we don't have voice chat-- it's one more thing for players to use. "You weren't listening to my voice chat? Wtf not?"

I don't care about everyone else - I want to be able to see *MY* ping before I queue up - why is there no 'Ping test' that would at the very least give us a ball park number...

Unfortunately this community makes it so we can't have nice things.  

With that having been said, sometimes I don't know which is worse; the toxic people or those that actually let it bother them to the point of complaining about it endlessly.  

Toxicity has a cause/effect relationship.  Remember how your parents used to tell you (if they were decent parents anyway), "if someone is teasing you just ignore them, they'll stop", and eventually they do.  If someone is carrying on about your "toaster loading" the game, then just ignore it.  If people just learned to not feed the trolls and further antagonize them, then there would be far less of them.  

It's one thing when someone runs it down mid and ruins your game, it's another when they say "fuck you" and then you decide to go off on a tangent of your own.  

What's the old saying, *"it takes two people to start an argument"*
Its not season 3, its season 2 i believe. Have a picture of loading screen (Cuz i reached 999+ping)

Because it creates a toxic environment right from the start, and it allows the enemy team to have an unfair advantage (knowledge wise) vs a player. op.gg is one thing, but knowing someone's ping is blatantly bullshit.
